# Dimensionality Reduction

## Data exploration

The data for this exercise can be accessed via this [link](http://s3.amazonaws.com/assets.datacamp.com/production/course_2218/datasets/human1.txt)

```{r}
human <- read.table("http://s3.amazonaws.com/assets.datacamp.com/production/course_2218/datasets/human1.txt", sep  =",", header = T)

#' data:  195 x 19
dim(human)

#' data structure
str(human)

#' check column names
colnames(human)
```

### Mutate Gross National Income (GNI) to numeric variable

```{r}
library(dplyr)

human <- human %>% mutate(
  GNI = as.numeric(gsub(",",".", gsub("\\.", "", GNI)))
)

str(human$GNI)
class(human)
head(data, 5)
```

```{r}
#' Select the following columns:
#' 'Country' 'Edu2.FM' 'Labo.FM' 'Edu.Exp'
#' 'Life.Exp' 'GNI' 'Mat.Mor' 'Ado.Birth' 'Parli.F'

w.human <- human %>% dplyr::select(c('Country', 'Edu2.FM', 'Labo.FM', 'Edu.Exp',
                                  'Life.Exp', 'GNI', 'Mat.Mor', 'Ado.Birth',
                                  'Parli.F'))

str(w.human)
dim(w.human)
colSums(is.na(w.human))
```



```{r}
#' Removing rows with NAs
complete.cases(w.human)
data.frame(w.human[-1], comp = complete.cases(w.human))
dat<-filter(w.human, complete.cases(w.human) == TRUE)

colSums(is.na(dat))
dim(dat)
```
